## CorrGrapheR

This package aims to plot correlations between variables in form of a graph. Variables correlated with each other shall be close (posivitely and negatively alike), and weakly correlated  - far from each other.

## Example 1 - Seatbelts

```{r cars}
df <- as.data.frame(datasets::Seatbelts) %>%
  select(-law)
plot_corrgraph(df)
```

## Example 2 - FIFA

```{r fifa}
load(normalizePath('../data/fifa20.rda'))
fifa20_selected <- fifa20[,c(4,5,7,8,11:13,17,25:26,45:78)]
nums <- unlist(lapply(fifa20_selected, is.numeric))
plot_corrgraph(fifa20_selected[,nums], cutoff = 0.3)
```
